basics.name: Chris Mahoney
basics.title: SDK Lead
basics.summary: Creative technical engineer, focused on emerging technology & Full-Stack JavaScript development.

work.name: LAMINA1
work.summary: Help build the backbone for the open metaverse.

work.name: Zudy
work.summary:
● Responsible for React-based application development utilizing proprietary software platform as REST API backend.
● Implemented RTK Query to improve existing Redux dispatch calls to backend, improving ability to use intelligent client caching.

work.name: Double A Labs
work.summary:
● Responsible for full-stack architecture vision and design of Phygital Worlds platform, allowing 3D interactive experiences utilizing Unity WebGL alongside standardized web frameworks such as ReactJS for enterprise clients.
● Synchronization of efforts across multi-functional Unity and web-based development teams: Unity WebGL player + React wrapper, Unity WebGL editor + backend client portal web application, systems management API.
● Emphasis on instilling quality standards throughout development teams and across platform architecture.
● Ad-hoc servant leadership as needed to inform, empower and unblock separate Unity & web teams consisting of 4-6 engineers each.

work.name: Double A Labs
work.summary:
● Responsible for proof-of-concept to delivery engineering of immersive,
interactive 3D collaboration solutions.

work.name: HIA Technologies
work.summary:
● Part of a cross-functional development team responsible for updating virtual human system developed at the USC Institute of Creative Technologies to leverage current AR technology and design natural, intuitive user experiences.
● Delivered system enabling cross-platform, touch-free conversational flow with virtual agents in Unity AR Foundation-based mobile application.
● Created reusable libraries for each aspect of virtual agent system to accelerate development and setup process. Automated generation of HTML-based code documentation with in-line source code & call graphs.
● Created prototypes around theoretical AR UX: Virtual human authoring, digital twin capture, user interaction across all modalities (desktop, web, AR spatial, AR facial tracking).

work.name: Accenture Interactive
work.summary:
● Member of Fjord XR team, responsible for conceptualization, design and development of various Unity AR/VR projects.
● Proactively developed prototypes and internal libraries to utilize multiple emerging technologies (In-engine Chrome browser prefab, SQL Server database access/data visualization, additive retrieval of HoloLens spatial mesh to NodeJS API)
● Developed in-browser 3D equipment visualizer for major industrial client project (A-Frame-based AngularJS component)
● Co-architected & developed Photogrammetry-as-a-service in partnership with Disney’s StudioLAB (React, Typescript, AWS). Presented at SXSW 2019 Interactive Cantina.
● Primary Unity developer, Kendra Scott AR Jewelry try-on demo. Presented at SXSW 2019 Interactive Cantina.

work.name: Unity Technologies
work.summary:
● Served as a member of Unity’s Cloud Build service delivery team.
● Responsible for development/maintenance of Unity Cloud Build features, including integration with all major supported source control management systems (Git, Subversion, Perforce, Mercurial).
● Responsible for feature addition and bug fixes throughout entire Cloud Build stack (NodeJS, Angular, MongoDB).
● Primary JavaScript engineer during transition from physical build farm to virtual machine resourcing/scheduling system.
● Primary developer for implementation of Git LFS subsystem across Cloud Build service.

work.name: BackOffice Associates
work.summary:
● Co-developed custom PowerShell Package Manager console and underlying package system to automate complex manual installation of ASP.Net/SQL Server environments.
● Responsible for major feature development and maintenance against proprietary ASP .Net application framework.
● Developed novel business process visualization prototype that was well-received during industry conference demonstrations (D3, NodeJS, MongoDB)
● Recipient of 2014 peer-determined innovation award within organization of 500+ developers and consultants.

work.name: BackOffice Associates
work.summary:
● Client-facing role. Installed, maintained and supported ASP .Net application system used by Fortune 500 enterprises to perform data migration to SAP ERP systems.
● Interfaced with and extracted large data volumes from a spectrum of source systems: MSSQL, DB2, AS/400, Oracle, BaaN, Active Directory, Progress, SAP , PeopleSoft, JD Edwards, client systems.
● Performed data quality analysis against multiple F500-scale ERP datasets across multiple verticals (manufacturing, insurance, retail merchandising).
● Automated, decreased server build times from 8+ hours to under two hours.

work.name: Convention Data Services
work.summary:
● Developed registration websites for convention attendees and exhibitor staff across multiple large events using ASP/PHP/SQL.
● Redesigned high-volume development deliverable (100+/year) to reduce turnaround from 12-16 hours to 2-4 hours.

specific.interestedBy: GraphQL, Building Information Modeling, Kubernetes, Redis
